metadata.docDescription: The following is a list of available options that can be specified in the `rserver.conf` configuration file, which controls behavior of the `rserver` process, allowing you to tune HTTP, authorization options, and other settings that broadly affect RStudio Server.

verify.name: verify-installation
verify.description: Runs verification mode to verify the current installation.

server.name: server-working-dir
server.description: The default working directory of the rserver process.

server.name: server-user
server.description: The user account of the rserver process.

server.name: server-daemonize

defaultValue.description: 1 (true) if rserver was run with root privilege, otherwise 0 (false).

server.description: Indicates whether or not the rserver process should run as a daemon.

server.name: server-pid-file
server.description: The path to a file where the rserver daemon's pid is written.

server.name: server-app-armor-enabled
server.description: Indicates whether or not to enable AppArmor profiles for the rserver process.

server.name: server-set-umask
server.description: If enabled, sets the rserver process umask to 022 on startup, which causes new files to have rw-r-r permissions.

server.name: secure-cookie-key-file
server.description: If set, overrides the default path of the secure-cookie-key file used for encrypting cookies.

server.name: server-data-dir
server.description: Path to the data directory where RStudio Server will write run-time state.

server.name: server-add-header
server.description: Adds a header to all responses from RStudio Server. This option can be specified multiple times to add multiple headers.

www.name: www-address
www.description: The network address that RStudio Server will listen on for incoming connections.

www.name: www-port
www.description: The port that RStudio Server will bind to while listening for incoming connections. If left empty, the port will be automatically determined based on your SSL settings (443 for SSL, 80 for no SSL).

www.name: www-root-path

defaultValue.description: Assume the root path '/' if not defined.

www.description: The path prefix added by a proxy to the incoming RStudio URL. This setting is used so RStudio Server knows what path it is being served from. If running RStudio Server behind a path-modifying proxy, this should be changed to match the base RStudio Server URL.

www.name: www-local-path
www.description: The relative path from the RStudio installation directory, or absolute path where web assets are stored.

www.name: www-symbol-maps-path
www.description: The relative path from the RStudio installation directory, or absolute path, where symbol maps are stored.

www.name: www-use-emulated-stack
www.description: Indicates whether or not to use GWT's emulated stack.

www.name: www-thread-pool-size
www.description: The size of the threadpool from which requests will be serviced. This may be increased to enable more concurrency, but should only be done if the underlying hardware has more than 2 cores. It is recommended to use a value that is <= to the number of hardware cores, or <= to two times the number of hardware cores if the hardware utilizes hyperthreading.

www.name: www-proxy-localhost
www.description: Indicates whether or not to proxy requests to localhost ports over the main server port. This should generally be enabled, and is used to proxy HTTP traffic within a session that belongs to code running within the session (e.g. Shiny or Plumber APIs)

www.name: www-verify-user-agent
www.description: Indicates whether or not to verify connecting browser user agents to ensure they are compatible with RStudio Server.

www.name: www-same-site
www.description: The value of the 'SameSite' attribute on the cookies issued by RStudio Server. Accepted values are 'none' or 'lax'. The value 'none' should be used only when RStudio is hosted into an iFrame. For compatibility with some browsers (i.e. Safari 12), duplicate cookies will be issued by RStudio Server when 'none' is used.

www.name: www-frame-origin
www.description: Specifies the allowed origin for the iFrame hosting RStudio if iFrame embedding is enabled.

www.name: www-enable-origin-check
www.description: If enabled, cause RStudio to enforce that incoming request origins are from the host domain. This can be added for additional security. See https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Cross-Site_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html#verifying-origin-with-standard-headers

www.name: www-allow-origin
www.description: Specifies an additional origin that requests are allowed from, even if it does not match the host domain. Used if origin checking is enabled. May be specified multiple times for multiple origins.

rsession.name: rsession-which-r
rsession.description: The path to the main R program (e.g. /usr/bin/R). This should be set if no versions are specified in /etc/rstudio/r-versions and the default R installation is not available on the system path.

rsession.name: rsession-path
rsession.description: The relative path from the RStudio installation directory, or absolute path to the rsession executable.

rsession.name: rldpath-path
rsession.description: The path to the r-ldpath script which specifies extra library paths for R versions.

rsession.name: rsession-ld-library-path
rsession.description: Specifies additional LD_LIBRARY_PATHs to use for R sessions.

rsession.name: rsession-config-file
rsession.description: If set, overrides the path to the /etc/rstudio/rsession.conf configuration file. The specified path may be a relative path from the RStudio installation directory, or an absolute path.

rsession.name: rsession-proxy-max-wait-secs
rsession.description: The maximum time to wait in seconds for a successful response when proxying requests to rsession.

rsession.name: rsession-memory-limit-mb
rsession.description: The limit in MB that an rsession process may consume.

rsession.name: rsession-stack-limit-mb
rsession.description: The limit in MB that an rsession process may consume for its stack.

rsession.name: rsession-process-limit
rsession.description: The maximum number of allowable rsession processes.

database.name: database-config-file
database.description: If set, overrides the path to the /etc/rstudio/database.conf configuration file.

defaultValue.description: 1 (true) if rserver was run without root privilege, otherwise 0 (false).

auth.name: auth-validate-users

defaultValue.description: 1 (true) if rserver was run with root privilege, otherwise 0 (false).

auth.description: Indicates whether or not to validate that authenticated users exist on the target system.

auth.name: auth-stay-signed-in-days
auth.description: The number of days to keep a user signed in when using the "Stay Signed In" option. Will only take affect when auth-timeout-minutes is 0 (disabled).

auth.name: auth-timeout-minutes
auth.description: The number of minutes a user will stay logged in while idle before required to sign in again. Set this to 0 (disabled) to enable legacy timeout auth-stay-signed-in-days.

auth.name: auth-encrypt-password
auth.description: Indicates whether or not to encrypt the password sent from the login form. For security purposes, we strongly recommend you leave this enabled.

auth.name: auth-login-page-html
auth.description: The path to a file containing additional HTML customization for the login page.

auth.name: auth-rdp-login-page-html
auth.description: The path to a file containing additional HTML customization for the login page, as seen by RDP users.

auth.name: auth-required-user-group
auth.description: Specifies a group that users must be in to be able to use RStudio.

auth.name: auth-minimum-user-id
auth.description: Specifies a minimum user id value. Users with a uid lower than this value may not use RStudio.

auth.name: auth-pam-helper-path
auth.description: The relative path from the RStudio installation directory, or absolute path where the PAM helper binary resides.

auth.name: auth-pam-require-password-prompt
auth.description: Indicates whether or not to require the "Password: " prompt before sending the password via PAM. In most cases, this should be enabled. If using a custom PAM password prompt, you may need to disable this setting if PAM logins do not work correctly.

auth.name: auth-sign-in-throttle-seconds
auth.description: The minimum amount of time a user must wait before attempting to sign in again after signing out.

auth.name: auth-revocation-list-dir
auth.description: If set, overrides the path to the directory which contains the revocation list to be used for storing expired tokens. As of RStudio Server 1.4, this has been moved to database storage, and so this setting is deprecated, but will be used to port over any existing file-based expired tokens.

auth.name: auth-cookies-force-secure
auth.description: Indicates whether or not auth cookies should be forcefully marked as secure. This should be enabled if running an SSL terminator infront of RStudio Server. Otherwise, cookies will be marked secure if SSL is configured.

monitor.description: The interval in seconds at which the monitor is probed for new data.
